GameDBLocalizedString.Text: Insecticide cream
Kills insects (parasites) that live on humans, such as the scabies mite and crab (pubic) lice. \n\nRequired room: Sexual Health office
Antiretroviral medication
Stops the virus replicating in the body, allowing the immune system to repair itself and preventing further damage. \n\nRequired room: Sexual Health office
Antiviral medication
Used specifically for treating viral infections. \n\nRequired room: Sexual Health office
Cryotherapy
Cryotherapy involves freezing a wart using a very cold substance (usually liquid nitrogen). \n\nRequired room: Sexual Health office
Antibiotics
Drugs in various forms used to treat various bacterial infections. \n\nRequired room: Sexual Health office
HPV Support
The doctor gives best recommendation and support for living with HPV. \n\nRequired room: Sexual Health office
PrEP
Pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) is the use of drugs to prevent HIV. \n\nRequired room: Sexual Health office
Viagra
Viagra (Sildenafil) is a medication used to treat erectile dysfunction. \n\nRequired room: Sexual Health office
Topical Retinoid

Topical retinoids are vitamin A derivatives (e.g., adapalene, tretinoin), first-line for comedonal and mixed acne, and can also improve post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation. Common irritation requires gradual use and sun protection.
Permethrin 5% Cream

Permethrin is a first-line acaricide for scabies. Apply all over the body (from the neck down) for 8–14 hours as directed, then wash off. Treat close contacts and the environment simultaneously to prevent re-infestation.
Narrowband UVB Phototherapy
Narrowband UVB phototherapy uses a specific wavelength of 311–313nm. It is suitable for psoriasis, atopic dermatitis, and vitiligo, offering good safety and longer remission periods.
Wet Wrap Therapy

Wet wrap therapy involves applying emollients or topical medications followed by layered wet dressings. It can quickly relieve itching and barrier damage in severe atopic dermatitis and should be performed under specialist guidance.
Anaphylaxis Protocol

The anaphylaxis protocol is a standard emergency procedure emphasizing immediate intramuscular epinephrine, ABC assessment, fluid resuscitation, and observation for biphasic reactions. Antihistamines/corticosteroids should not replace first-line treatment.
IV Methylprednisolone Pulse

IV methylprednisolone pulse therapy is a short course of high-dose intravenous methylprednisolone used for induction control of severe acute inflammatory/immune skin diseases. Close monitoring of blood pressure, blood glucose, and infection risk is required.
Systemic Terbinafine

Systemic terbinafine is an oral allylamine antifungal drug, commonly used for refractory tinea corporis/cruris/unguium and some tinea capitis. Pay attention to liver function monitoring and drug interactions.
Oral Dapsone

Dapsone is an anti-inflammatory/antibacterial drug, classically used for neutrophilic dermatoses like dermatitis herpetiformis. Assess for G6PD deficiency before use and watch for hemolytic anemia and methemoglobinemia.
Topical Hydroquinone

Topical hydroquinone is a phenolic depigmenting agent that reduces melanin production by inhibiting tyrosinase. It is mainly used for short-term maintenance treatment of melasma and post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation, requiring effective sun protection and prevention of exogenous ochronosis.
Wart Curettage

Wart curettage is the removal of single/refractory warts under local anesthesia. It can be combined with electrocautery or cryotherapy to reduce recurrence. Post-operative wound care and assessment of recurrence risk are necessary.
Hidradenitis Suppurativa Deroofing

Hidradenitis suppurativa deroofing is a selective incision and unroofing procedure for HS sinus tracts, removing the "roof" and fibrous tissue to allow for secondary intention healing and reduce recurrence.
